Title: Main Page - App Restoration
Expected Result:
THEN the batter logo screen appears (indicating a cold start)
AND the home tab appears at the bottom of the app
Preconditions:
GIVEN a user
AND on iOS devices, Settings/Developer/Fast App Termination is set to on

To do: Is a similar setting needed/available on Android?
Steps:
WHEN the app is put in the background for >30s
AND the app is restored to the foreground

Title: Main Page - Apollo Environment switching - Internal builds
Expected Result:
THEN the Apollo environment api endpoint will change as follows:

PROD: https://data-graph.mlb.com/graphql
QA: https://data-graph-qa.mlb.com/graphql
BETA: https://data-graph-beta.mlb.com/graphql

Standalone versions and current android version also can switch to the following:
DEV: https://data-graph-dev.mlb.com/graphql
QA: https://data-graph-qa.mlb.com/graphql
MASTER: https://data-graph-master.mlb.com/graphql (set by selecting 'staging' on iOS)
Preconditions: GIVEN a user running an internal or debug build
Steps: WHEN the environment is changed

Title: Main Page - Support Inline Adaptive Banner Ad Size
Steps Separated:
1. GIVEN that I have an ad module
WHEN I have not added a unit ID

Expected Result:
THEN the ad will send the default unit id to google ad platform
2. GIVEN that I have an ad module in a team surface
WHEN I have added a unit ID
AND I have added a template values in the unit id for ${siteId}, ${account}, ${platform}, and ${team}

ex. /${siteId}/${account}/${team}/home/${platform}

*Where:
siteId = 2605
account = paid / free in our case it will always be free
platform = android
Expected Result:
THEN the ad will send the composed path to google ad manager replacing ${siteid}, ${account}, ${platform}, and ${team} with appropriate values
3. GIVEN that I have an ad module in a team surface
WHEN I have not set a max width

Expected Result:
THEN the ad should leverage the screen size as the width
4. GIVEN that I have an ad module in a team surface
WHEN I have set a max width

Expected Result:
THEN the ad should leverage the max width to determine size
5. GIVEN that I have an ad module in a team surface
WHEN I have not set a max height

Expected Result:
THEN google ad manager should pick a height for the ad
6. GIVEN that I have an ad module in a team surface
WHEN I have set a max height

Expected Result:
THEN the ad should fit within the max height
7. GIVEN that I have an ad module in a team surface
WHEN I have not set a URL

Expected Result:
THEN the default URL should be passed to google ad manager
8. GIVEN that I have an ad module in a team surface
WHEN I have set a URL with a template value of ${team}

Expected Result:
THEN the the url should be passed to google ad manager and the team template should be populated
Steps Separated (Expected Result):
1. THEN the ad will send the default unit id to google ad platform
2. THEN the ad will send the composed path to google ad manager replacing ${siteid}, ${account}, ${platform}, and ${team} with appropriate values
3. THEN the ad should leverage the screen size as the width
4. THEN the ad should leverage the max width to determine size
5. THEN google ad manager should pick a height for the ad
6. THEN the ad should fit within the max height
7. THEN the default URL should be passed to google ad manager
8. THEN the the url should be passed to google ad manager and the team template should be populated
Steps Separated (Step):
1. GIVEN that I have an ad module
WHEN I have not added a unit ID

2. GIVEN that I have an ad module in a team surface
WHEN I have added a unit ID
AND I have added a template values in the unit id for ${siteId}, ${account}, ${platform}, and ${team}

ex. /${siteId}/${account}/${team}/home/${platform}

*Where:
siteId = 2605
account = paid / free in our case it will always be free
platform = android
3. GIVEN that I have an ad module in a team surface
WHEN I have not set a max width

4. GIVEN that I have an ad module in a team surface
WHEN I have set a max width

5. GIVEN that I have an ad module in a team surface
WHEN I have not set a max height

6. GIVEN that I have an ad module in a team surface
WHEN I have set a max height

7. GIVEN that I have an ad module in a team surface
WHEN I have not set a URL

8. GIVEN that I have an ad module in a team surface
WHEN I have set a URL with a template value of ${team}

Title: Midfield - Default api timeout, override

    {"midfield": {"timeout": 60}}

AND I should be able to use the long response times that come back on QA

2. THEN the timeout should be set to 60 seconds
AND I should be able to use the long response times that come back on QA

AND a throttled the connection to Midfield

    {"midfield": {"timeout": 60}}

Title: Main Page - Default surface loads on api call failure
Preconditions: GIVEN that I have home active in the MLB app
Steps Separated:
1. AND I am opening the app for the first time (or cold starting the app)
AND the request for loading the surface configuration fails
Expected Result:
THEN I should get the backup/default surface
2. WHEN I have previously opened the home tab and had is successfully load
AND the app is restarted
AND the request for loading the surface configuration fails
Expected Result:
THEN I should get the backup/default surface
3. WHEN I have previously opened the home tab and had is successfully load
AND the request for loading the surface configuration fails
AND the surface is refreshed (app not restarted)
Expected Result:
THEN the same surface continues to load (iOS only)

Note: currently for Android, surface is only retained for 30s, then on next call default surface loads
Steps Separated (Expected Result):
1. THEN I should get the backup/default surface
2. THEN I should get the backup/default surface
3. THEN the same surface continues to load (iOS only)

Note: currently for Android, surface is only retained for 30s, then on next call default surface loads
Steps Separated (Step):
1. AND I am opening the app for the first time (or cold starting the app)
AND the request for loading the surface configuration fails
2. WHEN I have previously opened the home tab and had is successfully load
AND the app is restarted
AND the request for loading the surface configuration fails
3. WHEN I have previously opened the home tab and had is successfully load
AND the request for loading the surface configuration fails
AND the surface is refreshed (app not restarted)

Title: Main Page - navigation - Analytics
Steps Separated:
1. GIVEN a user
WHEN they navigate to the Home page on initial launch of app
Expected Result:
THEN the following data will be logged to Adobe:

trackState:	   MLB App : <platform> : Home Feed : MLB
p13n.puid          <puid>
channel:           Home Feed
surface.pullToRefresh   false

Note: if no team is selected on the page, then the team name will be MLB
2. GIVEN a user on the home surface
WHEN they pull to refresh the Home page
Expected Result:
THEN the following data will be logged to Adobe:

trackState:	   MLB App : <platform> : Home Feed : MLB
p13n.puid          <puid>
channel:           Home Feed
surface.pullToRefresh   true
3. GIVEN a user on the home surface
WHEN they tab away and return
OR the app is backgrounded and restored
Expected Result:
THEN the following data will be logged to Adobe:

trackState:	   MLB App : <platform> : Home Feed : MLB
p13n.puid          <puid>
channel:           Home Feed
surface.pullToRefresh   false
4. GIVEN a user on the Home Page
WHEN web content (ex. VSM, Short, or Game Stories) is tapped and then closed, exposing the Home surface again
Expected Result:
THEN the following data will be logged to Adobe:

trackState:	   MLB App : <platform> : Home Feed : MLB
p13n.puid          <puid>
channel:           Home Feed
surface.pullToRefresh   false

Note: if no team is selected on the page, then the team name will be MLB
Steps Separated (Expected Result):
1. THEN the following data will be logged to Adobe:

trackState:	   MLB App : <platform> : Home Feed : MLB
p13n.puid          <puid>
channel:           Home Feed
surface.pullToRefresh   false

Title: Main Page - Scroll Depth Tracking - Analytics

Notes:

Preconditions: GIVEN a user on the Home tab
Steps: WHEN the user exits the MLB App or leaves the surface

Title: Conviva Video Analytics
Expected Result:
THEN conviva will receive a tag value of ?Home Surface? (see videoSiteSection below)
AND also for all subsequent calls related to the session
AND the following custom tags are sent:

fguid -             Unique session ID: A guid that should be automatically generated for every stream session. It is the same value we should be passing to Adobe.

med -                Media type: Should be VIDEO

pbs -                Playback scenario: Should be HLSCLOUD

plt -                Platform: Should be iphone,iPad or ANDROID_MOBILE depending  on the platform.

prt -               Partner: Should be mlb for vod, mlb_stream for live mode

state -             Media State:  N/A for vod,  ON for live mode

userId -            Okta User ID: This is redundant to CIS_SSDK_METADATA_VIEWER_ID but kept for reporting backend purposes. Either the users Okta ID, or if they are not logged on, an empty string

ver -                Version: The version of the MLB App

productType -        Product Type: Should be non-game for vod, game for live mode

contentType -        Content Type: One of either VOD, SVOD, LIVE, SLIVE or ADHOC.

autoplayType -  "surfaceAutoplay" for autoplay, "N/A" for regular play or live mode

categoryType -       Category Type: A concatenation of the title field for all of the item?s Forge tags delimited by a comma and a space. Ex: Season 2022, 2022/08/11 cws@kc, Vinnie Pasquantino, Kansas City Royals, hitting, highlight, in-game highlight, home run, Yahoo In-Game, 2-Yahoo MLB Ads Feed, Send To News MLB feed, "Live Game" for live mode

videoSiteSection -   Video Site Section: The section of the app that this video was viewed on. Should be the same value we pass to Adobe in the video.context field.  Should be "Home Feed Live" for live mode

AND the following required tags are sent:


an - CIS_SSDK_METADATA_ASSET_NAME - The Item.slug from the Forge response ex. for live mode "2024-10-11 - Houston Astros @ Texas Rangers | HOME | VIDEO | en"

url - CIS_SSDK_METADATA_STREAM_URL - The manifest URL of the stream. Should be a .m3u8 file

lv - CIS_SSDK_METADATA_IS_LIVE - Boolean value indicating if the stream is live or not NSNumber(value: isLive).  Should be true for live mode

pn - CIS_SSDK_METADATA_PLAYER_NAME - Name of the player. iOS uses MLB.TV AVPlayer, but you may want to use something like Home Surface AVPlayer, "ExoPlayer" for live mode

vid - CIS_SSDK_METADATA_VIEWER_ID - The users Okta ID if logged in, otherwise empty string

Steps Separated:
1. WHEN the Headline Stack section is viewed
Expected Result:
THEN a configured portion of the list displays with a 'See All' in the footer
2. WHEN 'See All' is Tapped
Expected Result:
THE the full list is displayed
3. WHEN 'See Less' is tapped (Android) or back is tapped (iOS)
Expected Result:
THEN the compact list is seen
Steps Separated (Expected Result):
1. THEN a configured portion of the list displays with a 'See All' in the footer
2. THE the full list is displayed
3. THEN the compact list is seen
Steps Separated (Step):
1. WHEN the Headline Stack section is viewed
2. WHEN 'See All' is Tapped
3. WHEN 'See Less' is tapped (Android) or back is tapped (iOS)

Title: Headline Stack - tapping content
Preconditions: GIVEN a use on the Home Surface
Steps Separated:
1. WHEN an article, short, video or VSM content item is tapped
Expected Result:
THEN the content opens
AND an analytics call is made
2. WHEN close/back is tapped while viewing the content
Expected Result:
THEN the user will be returned to the home surface
Steps Separated (Expected Result):
1. THEN the content opens
AND an analytics call is made
2. THEN the user will be returned to the home surface
Steps Separated (Step):
1. WHEN an article, short, video or VSM content item is tapped
2. WHEN close/back is tapped while viewing the content

Title: Headline Stack - video support
Preconditions: GIVEN a Headline Stack Module configured to support video
Steps Separated:
1. WHEN a entity of type video exists in the list

Expected Result:
THEN the video fields.blurb shows as the video headline
2. WHEN a user clicks on the video headline
Expected Result:
THEN the video plays in the video player
3. WHEN a user clicks on the video headline
Expected Result:
THEN the analytics trackAction should fire MLB At Bat : iPhone : Home Feed : MLB : Headline Stack : Headline Click
AND  the contextData should contain action.element.contentType: <content type>
Steps Separated (Expected Result):
1. THEN the video fields.blurb shows as the video headline
2. THEN the video plays in the video player
3. THEN the analytics trackAction should fire MLB At Bat : iPhone : Home Feed : MLB : Headline Stack : Headline Click
AND  the contextData should contain action.element.contentType: <content type>
Steps Separated (Step):
1. WHEN a entity of type video exists in the list

2. WHEN a user clicks on the video headline
3. WHEN a user clicks on the video headline

Title: Headline Stack - Swip, Game and Preview Stories

Steps Separated:
1. WHEN an item is of type story ("_typename": "Article")
AND the item storyType is Swipe Story, Game Story, or Preview Story
Expected Result:
THEN the story is rendered in the Headline Stack

2. WHEN the item is tapped
Expected Result:
THEN the story is rendered in a sheet on iOS and a Chrometab on Android

1. THEN the story is rendered in the Headline Stack

2. THEN the story is rendered in a sheet on iOS and a Chrometab on Android
Steps Separated (Step):
1. WHEN an item is of type story ("_typename": "Article")
AND the item storyType is Swipe Story, Game Story, or Preview Story
2. WHEN the item is tapped

THEN a Video or Story icon will display under the headline text
AND the  text part of the icon (Story, Video) will be localized (Cronica, Video in Spanish)

Steps: WHEN the module is loaded

Title: Article Title Header - News deprecated
Expected Result:
THEN the user will see the word "News" displayed in EN
AND the word "Noticias" in ES
AND the article title will not be displayed in the header
Preconditions: GIVEN the user is viewing a webview article from the Mixed Feed
Steps: WHEN the user views the header of the article

Title: Removal of Tab Bar when viewing articles
Expected Result: THEN the Tab Bar will not be visible to the user while viewing the article
Preconditions: GIVEN the user taps on an article in the Home Mixed Feed
Steps: WHEN the user navigates to the article

Title: Edge Swiping
Expected Result: THEN the user can edge gesture swipe back to the previous screen
Preconditions:
GIVEN the user taps on the Mixed Feed section
AND the user taps on an article in the News Index
Steps: WHEN the user decides to go back to the previous News Index

Title: Returning to News Index via Edge Swiping (Stacking Articles)
Expected Result: THEN the user is able to navigate back through the stacked articles one-by-one to the News Index by Edge swiping.
Preconditions:
GIVEN the user taps on the Home Mixed Feed section
AND the user taps on an article
Steps:
WHEN the user navigates through multiple articles within the view
AND the articles stack on top of each other

Title: Invalid URLs in newsreader
Expected Result: THEN the user should see an alert or other messaging stating that there is a problem with the URL
Preconditions: GIVEN the user taps on an article in the Mixed Feed
Steps: WHEN there is a malformed URL or the URL is unable to load for whatever reason

Title: "Done" Button  Functionality - Push Notifications
Expected Result: THEN the Done button will take the user back to the default view
Preconditions: GIVEN the user receives a push notification that opens up a News story
Steps:
WHEN the user views the news story
from any  notification

Title: Player Card - Push Notification
Expected Result: THEN the Player card should present modally on top of the story, without dismissing the article below it
Preconditions: GIVEN the user has a notification for a news article that includes a player link
Steps:
When the user opens the notification
AND tap on the player link

Title: Mixed Feed - Player Card - X button
Expected Result:
THEN the player card opens in a modal on top of the article
and it includes an "X" button to close the modal
Preconditions: GIVEN the user is viewing a webview article from the Mixed Feed
Steps: WHEN the user tap on a player link in the webview article

Title: Scroll Indicator

Preconditions:
GIVEN
- Device setting is on dark mode
- the user is on the Mixed Feed
Steps: AND the user taps on an article and scroll

Title: Loading indicator (Low connectivity)
Expected Result: THEN Loading indicator should appear before every article load
Preconditions: GIVEN the user is on low connectivity environment
Steps: WHEN user taps on an article from the Home Tab News index

Title: Mixed Feed - Share Functionality Within Article
Expected Result:
THEN the system share tray will be visible
AND the user is able to share the content to their desired platform
Preconditions:
GIVEN the user is on the Mixed Feed
AND the user taps on an article
Steps:
WHEN the user is viewing the webview article
AND there is a Share button available to tap on

Title: Localization (Spanish ES)

Preconditions:
GIVEN the user's device language settings is set to ES (Spanish)
AND the user is on the Mixed Feed section
AND the user taps on an article
Steps: WHEN the user views the Mixed Feed and article

Title: Dark/Light Mode Support
Expected Result:
THEN the user's device Dark/Light mode should be respected
AND the article should be displayed based on their preferences
Preconditions:
GIVEN the user has their device in Light Mode
OR the user has their device in dark mode

Title: Mixed Feed content click - Analytics
Expected Result:
THEN data similar to the following example is logged to Adobe:

trackAction:	MLB App : Home Feed : MLB : Mixed Feed : Content Card Click
action.element.index:	1
action.element.text:	"Hot Stove previews Hall of Fame"
action.element.sectionTitle:	"News"
action.element.sectionIndex:	2
** for video **
action.element.video.slug:	hot-stove-previews-hall-of-fame
"action.element.contentType": "video"
** for article **
action.element.article.slug:	hot-stove-previews-hall-of-fame
"action.element.contentType": "article"
** short content **
"action.element.shortcontent.slug": "the-slug-of-the-shortcontent"
"action.element.contentType": "shortcontent"
** for VSM content **
"action.element.vsmcontent.slug": "the-slug-of-the-vsmcontent"
"action.element.contentType": "vsmcontent"

AND if it is a video, the following will also be sent:

video.autoplay = false
video.contentId
video.title
video.contentType
Preconditions: GIVEN a user of the Home Page mixed feed
Steps: WHEN content of type article, video, VSM, or Short is tapped

Title: MxFd - Breaking News Badge - Analytics
Expected Result:
THEN a tracking call sent to adobe with the following parameters, for example:

  "action.element.contentType": "article",
  "action.element.index": "0",
  "action.element.sectionIndex": "0",
  "action.element.sectionTitle": <module headerText>,
  "action.element.text": <article headline>,
  "action.element.article.slug": "mixed-feed-item-1-slug",
  "p13n.contentFlag": "false",
  "p13n.puid": "mixed-feed-puid",   //If present
  "surface.slug": "some-slug"
  "article.isBreakingNews": "true", // only added if this is a breakingNews item   // Android Only
  ?action.element.contentLabels": "breakingNews",
  "action.element.badges": "breakingNews"   // Android Only
Preconditions: GIVEN that an article is flagged for breaking news (ex. Set as "Featured" in Forge)
Steps: WHEN it is tapped

Title: Ads - In-line - specific user entitlement is sent in admanager request
Expected Result:
THEN the specific entitlements of the user will be sent in the cust_params query param in the form entitlments=<specificEntitlements>
where specificEntitlements are, for example:

single team: MLBTV_STP_MIN, SUBSCRIBERVOD,
MLB.TV: MLBALL,SUBSCRIBERVOD,
audio only: IPHONEATBAT,MLBAUDIO,
AtBat: ANDROIDATBAT, SUBSCRIBERVOD
free user: free
Preconditions: GIVEN a free or subscribed user on the home surface
Steps:
WHEN an inline ad is scrolled into view
AND a request is made to the ad manager
ex. GET https://pubads.g.doubleclick.net/gampad/ads?*

AND in-line ads are configured

AND in-line ads are configured

Title: Configurable home surface basic

Title: Configurable home surface add modules

THEN we recompose the UI in such a way that the pre existing UI widgets are not redrawn
(ex. a module at the top that is still at the top in the config file is not redrawn)

GIVEN a home feed configuration json file that contains an ordered list of modules
AND the home feed UI is already showing content
Steps:
WHEN the request is complete and turned into a model
AND the config file contains 2 more modules in addition to the already existing ones

Title: Configurable home surface reorder modules

WHEN the modules are added, removed or rearranged in a different order

{
"enabled": true,
"dataSource": "contentful",

}

  "clubSurfaceSlug": "club-home-surface",
}

"enabled": true,

"debugEnabled": false,

"clubSurfaceSlug": "club-home-surface"
}

ex. Android:

  "dataSource":"STATIC",

  "clubSurfaceSlug": "club-home-surface",
	}
}

AND a static configuration will be used for the feed

 ex. iOS:

Title: Midfield headers
Preconditions: GIVEN a user loading any surface
Steps Separated:
1. WHEN a location is set within the app

Expected Result:
THEN there should be a location header sent with the key "mlb-geolocation"
AND the value should be a JSON payload in the following format: {"zip": "12345", "lat": 0.00, "lon": 0.00}
2. WHEN a location is NOT set within the app
Expected Result:
THEN there should be no location header
3. WHEN they are logged into the app

Expected Result:
THEN there should be an "Authorization" header sent
AND the value should be the user's auth token prefixed with "Bearer"
Example: Authorization: Bearer XXXXX
4. WHEN they are NOT logged into the app
Expected Result:
THEN there should be NO "Authorization" header sent
5. WHEN they check headers

Expected Result:
THEN there should be a header sent with the key "mlb-aecid"
AND the value should match my adobe experience content id

6. WHEN they check headers

Expected Result:
THEN there should be a header sent with the key "mlb-env"
AND the value should match the environment I have currently selected (may only be applicable in the microapp)
7. WHEN they are an anonymous in app purchase user

Expected Result:
THEN there should be a header sent with the key "mlb-iapid"
AND the value should be the receipt id used for all in app purchase authorizations

Note: currently iOS only
8. WHEN they check headers


Expected Result:
THEN the unique device id should be sent as a header with the name mlb-mobile-uid

Android: Advertising Id
iOS:     ID8
9. WHEN they check headers
Expected Result:
THEN the "cookie" header will be sent
Steps Separated (Expected Result):
1. THEN there should be a location header sent with the key "mlb-geolocation"
AND the value should be a JSON payload in the following format: {"zip": "12345", "lat": 0.00, "lon": 0.00}
2. THEN there should be no location header
3. THEN there should be an "Authorization" header sent
AND the value should be the user's auth token prefixed with "Bearer"
Example: Authorization: Bearer XXXXX
4. THEN there should be NO "Authorization" header sent
5. THEN there should be a header sent with the key "mlb-aecid"
AND the value should match my adobe experience content id

6. THEN there should be a header sent with the key "mlb-env"
AND the value should match the environment I have currently selected (may only be applicable in the microapp)
7. THEN there should be a header sent with the key "mlb-iapid"
AND the value should be the receipt id used for all in app purchase authorizations

Note: currently iOS only
8. THEN the unique device id should be sent as a header with the name mlb-mobile-uid

Android: Advertising Id
iOS:     ID8
9. THEN the "cookie" header will be sent
Steps Separated (Step):
1. WHEN a location is set within the app

2. WHEN a location is NOT set within the app
3. WHEN they are logged into the app

4. WHEN they are NOT logged into the app
5. WHEN they check headers

6. WHEN they check headers

7. WHEN they are an anonymous in app purchase user

8. WHEN they check headers


9. WHEN they check headers

Title: Short Content - display in mixed feed
Expected Result:

AND the blurb text (usually a portion of the article) will display below the timeframe
Preconditions: GIVEN a use on the Home tab

Title: Managing the home feed [OFF] states
Expected Result: The home feed module is removed from the bottom menu.
Preconditions:
A) The appnavigation_en.json file contains a DISABLED home feed element (this is the default value from https://storage.mobile.mlbinfra.com/atbatconfig/appnavigation_en.json, we shouldn't modify this until we are done with a/b testing and we are ready to do a 100% roll out.)
B) The adobe target activity is disabled (don't just change percentage, actually disable)
C) The user was opted in the Home feed experience
D) The user was able to see the Home feed in the app
Steps:
Workflow A)
1) The user is running the app in the background
2) The user waits 15 (could be 10 mins or could be 20 there's a flexible 5 minute window) minutes
3) The app triggers a new config update cycle, getting a config with home feed disabled and ex. news enabled.
4) The app is unable to get a value from adobe target since the activity is disabled.
5) The user CLOSES the app
5) The app keeps the news module and kicks out the home feed module.

Workflow B)
1) The user is running the app in the background
2) The user hard closes the app and 15 minutes have passed since the last menu config update cycle.
3) The user reopens the app
4) The user triggers an immediate config request by hard closing and reopening the app
6) The user CLOSES the app.
7) The user opens the app and the bottom menu is now showing ex. a news module instead of the home feed surface.

Title: Managing the home feed [ON] states
Expected Result: The user gets a Home feed module in the bottom menu after reopening the app after some time passed(15 min debug - 60 min prod) since they got a news module
Preconditions:
A) The appnavigation_en.json file contains a DISABLED home feed element (this is the default value from https://storage.mobile.mlbinfra.com/atbatconfig/appnavigation_en.json, we shouldn't modify this until we are done with a/b testing and we are ready to do a 100% roll out.)
B) The adobe target activity is Live and the distribution % of the home feed experience is set to something greater than 0 and has just been created
C) A user is opted in the home feed experience
Steps:
1) The user opens the app and they get a news or home module
2) 15 minutes pass since the last config update cycle
3) the app gets the new menu config and the adobe target home feed experience
4) the user CLOSES the app
5) the user reopens the app and now they get a Home feed module

1) The user installs the app and they get a home module
2) 15 minutes pass since the last config update cycle
3) the app gets the new menu config and the adobe target home feed experience
4) the user CLOSES the app
5) the user reopens the app and now they get a Home feed module

Title: Turning OFF the A/B experiment and loading the configuration in appnavigation_en.json
Preconditions:
At some point we will make the Home feed a permanent item in the bottom menu
A) The adobe target activity is disabled
B) The appnavigation_en.json file contains a DISABLED news module and an ENABLED home feed module OR  The appnavigation_en.json file contains an ENABLED news module and a DISABLED home feed module
C) The firebase home_feed_switch flag is off

This case should be covered in https://testrail.testeng.mlbinfra.net/index.php?/cases/view/28020929  I wanted to emphasize that this use case is the ONLY ONE that involves modifying the appnavigation_en.json file. This use case represents the scenario when we are done with adobe target and we want to push homefeed (or keep news) as a normal module in production.

This test case is about validating the different states of the menu once we turn off the A/B testing via firebase
Steps:
Scenario A) home feed is ready to be delivered to 100% of the user base (home feed is enabled in appnavigation_en.json)
1) The user previously had the Home feed module in the bottom menu
2) the preconditions are met
3) The next config update cycle is triggered.
4) The user closes the app
5) the user reopens the app
6) The app still shows the Home feed in the bottom menu

Scenario B) home feed is ready to be delivered to 100% of the user base (home feed is enabled in appnavigation_en.json)
1) The user previously had the News module in the bottom menu
2) the preconditions are met
3) The next config update cycle is triggered.
4) The user closes the app
5) the user reopens the app
6) The app  shows the Home feed instead of the News module in the bottom menu

Scenario C) We are done A/B testing but we want to keep news in the bottom menu (home feed is disabled in appnavigation_en.json)
1) The user previously had the News module in the bottom menu
2) the preconditions are met
3) The next config update cycle is triggered.
4) The user closes the app
5) the user reopens the app
6) The app  shows news instead of the home feed module in the bottom menu

Scenario D) We are done A/B testing but we want to keep news in the bottom menu (home feed is disabled in appnavigation_en.json)
1) The user previously had the home feed module in the bottom menu
2) the preconditions are met
3) The next config update cycle is triggered.
4) The user closes the app
5) the user reopens the app
6) The app  shows news instead of the home feed module in the bottom menu

Title: Controlling the whole  Home feed A/B testing workflow using Firebase
Expected Result:
We are able to skip the whole Home feed injection process and show the default values we get from appnavigation_en.json
We are able to execute the whole Home feed injection process and inject the homefeed/news experience from adobe target
Preconditions:
Workflow A (home feed experiment Off)
The home feed feature flag is disabled in the Firebase remote configs
Prod:https://console.firebase.google.com/project/api-project-73121217114/config
Debug: https://console.firebase.google.com/project/mlb-mobile-npd/config

Workflow B (home feed experiment On)
The home feed feature flag is enabled in the Firebase remote configs
Prod:https://console.firebase.google.com/project/api-project-73121217114/config
Debug: https://console.firebase.google.com/project/mlb-mobile-npd/config
Steps:
Workflow A (home feed experiment Off)
1)Firebase remote config are pulled in and the home feed flag is set to false
2)The user is installing the app for the first time or an config update cycle is completed
3)We skip the adobe target validation, no network call should be showing up in charles: https://mboxedge34.tt.omtrdc.net Or https://mlbadvancedmedialp.tt.omtrdc.net or any other variants (Note: similar calls should still be visible, like the ones used to get the paywall config.)
4)The visibility of the home feed is controlled only by the appnavigation_en.json

Workflow B (home feed On)
1)Firebase remote config are pulled in and the home feed flag is set to true
2)The user is installing the app for the first time or an config update cycle is completed
3)We can see the adobe target validation, a network call should be showing up in charles: https://mboxedge34.tt.omtrdc.net Or https://mlbadvancedmedialp.tt.omtrdc.net or any other variants (Note: similar calls should still be visible, like the ones used to get the paywall config.)
4)The visibility of the home feed is controlled only by the adobe target activity.

Append: p=<slug>&ec=false

Notes:

Title: Analytics
Steps:
Description:

Add trackAction events for Standings Module carousel scrolls & clicks to view full standings

When I scroll through the Standings Module, fire the following trackAction on snap to next index:

trackAction: MLB App : Home Feed : <club abbreviation or 'MLB'> : Standings : Carousel Scroll
action.element.index: <the index of the carousel element to which the user snapped>
action.element.text: <the visible text of the carousel element to which the user snapped> ex) "NL East", "AL East", etc
action.element.sectionIndex: <the index of the section where the module is located>
action.element.sectionTitle: "Standings"
When I click to view full standings from the Standings Module, fire the following trackAction on the click:

trackAction: MLB App : Home Feed : <club abbreviation or 'MLB'> : Standings : Expand Click
action.element.index: 0
action.element.text: "View Full Standings"
action.element.sectionIndex: <the index of the section where the module is located>
action.element.sectionTitle: "Standings"
Steps Separated:
1. Scroll the standings carrousel.

A/C

The dimensions of the containers of any text should be constant, a small or large font size should not change the alignment of any of the elements in the view, this includes pushing out columns/rows that don?t fit in the view.

The text views should define a max and min font size to avoid having display issues.

Title: Team Snapshot - Contentful Config API
Preconditions: GIVEN access to Contentful
Steps Separated:
1. WHEN a surface is edited
Expected Result:
THEN a TeamSnapshotModule can be added Successfully added/published to the surface
2. WHEN the TeamSnapshotModule is edited
AND the Spanish localization is added

THEN the following settings will be available:
          "Name"
          "teamOverride"
          "tesmSnapshotFlipTime"
          "hideAfterGameDuration"
          "flipTime"
          "teamElements" (English - checkboxes)
            "SCHEDULE",
            "MATCHUP",
            "PLAYERS",
            "BROADCASTS",
            "PRODUCT_LINKS",
            "HEADER"
          "teamElements" (Spanish - checkboxes)
            "SCHEDULE",
            "MATCHUP",
            "PLAYERS",
            "BROADCASTS",
            "PRODUCT_LINKS",
            "HEADER"
          "displayGroup"
3. WHEN any settings are changed, and the call is midfield is made

THEN the response will reflect the setting changes (note: "Name" will not be returned.)
4. WHEN the call to midfield is made with the language set to EN_US (English)
Expected Result:
THEN the English Elements are returned
5. WHEN the call to midfield is made with the language set to ES_US (Spanish)
Expected Result:
THEN the Spanish Elements are returned

          "Name"

            "HEADER"

3. THEN the response will reflect the setting changes (note: "Name" will not be returned.)

Title: Team Snapshot - Refresh Rate
Preconditions: GINEN a team snapshot module in a surface
Steps Separated:
1. WHEN modifying a team snapshot module in contentful

Expected Result:
THEN a field to control the refresh rate of the snapshot is present
AND that field should be optional
AND that field should only accept numbers
AND that field should not allow anything lower than 10

2. WHEN the refresh rate on that module is not set


Expected Result:
THEN the team snapshot should not refresh automatically
3. WHEN the refresh rate on the module is set

Expected Result:
THEN the module should make a new request for the team snapshot
AND when it is finished it should do it again after the durreation specified in the refresh rate

4. WHEN I change the surface
AND the new surface has no team snapshot module


Expected Result:
THEN there should be no polling of the team snapshot
5. WHEN it is has a refresh rate set and is polling
AND I switch to another view

Expected Result:
THEN polling should pause
AND polling should resume when switching switch back to the home surface
Steps Separated (Expected Result):
1. THEN a field to control the refresh rate of the snapshot is present
AND that field should be optional
AND that field should only accept numbers
AND that field should not allow anything lower than 10

2. THEN the team snapshot should not refresh automatically
3. THEN the module should make a new request for the team snapshot
AND when it is finished it should do it again after the durreation specified in the refresh rate

4. THEN there should be no polling of the team snapshot
5. THEN polling should pause
AND polling should resume when switching switch back to the home surface
Steps Separated (Step):
1. WHEN modifying a team snapshot module in contentful

2. WHEN the refresh rate on that module is not set


3. WHEN the refresh rate on the module is set

4. WHEN I change the surface
AND the new surface has no team snapshot module


5. WHEN it is has a refresh rate set and is polling
AND I switch to another view

AND return to the home surface

AND reopened to the home surface

Title: My Follows Carousel - Contentful Config
Preconditions:
GIVEN a user editing a My Follows Carousel module that has been added to a Home Surface
AND Spanish locale is added
AND the user has created an account setting followed player(s)
Steps Separated:
1. WHEN the Name is set and published
Expected Result:
THEN it will persist
AND have no affect on the module displaying on the client
2. WHEN the HeaderText is set
Expected Result:
THEN it will display on the module header on the left
AND the Spanish text set will display when the device is set to Spanish
3. WHEN the ActionText is set
Expected Result:
THEN it will display on the module header on the right
AND the Spanish text set will display when the device is set to Spanish
4. WHEN "players" is selected for FollowedTypes
AND the PlayerLimit >= # followed players set
Expected Result:
THEN all the user's followed players cards will display in the carousel

5. WHEN "teams" is selected for FollowedTypes
Expected Result:
THEN the selection will seen in the API response
AND will have no adverse affects on the module
6. WHEN any of the Elements "header, keyGame, stats, highlights, nextGame" are selected
AND "players" is selected for FollowedTypes
Expected Result:
THEN they will display in the module (only if selected)
AND the Spanish elements set will display when the device is set to Spanish
note: keyGame, nextGame selections currently will be returned in API response  but will have effect on the module
7. WHEN the PlayerLimit is set to a positive integer (ex. 3)
AND "players" is selected for FollowedTypes
Expected Result:
THEN the number of user's followed players cards will display in the carousel will be limited by the PlayerLimit setting)
8. WHEN the SeasonYear is set to a year that is not the current season (exc. 2022)
Expected Result:
THEN the setting will have no effect
Future:
THEN the player data displayed will reflect the set season instead of the default season being used (ex. 2023)
9. WHEN the GameType is set with a comma separated list of types from https://statsapi.mlb.com/api/v1/gameTypes
Expected Result:
THEN games of the set types will be displayed regardless of the point in the season (ex. Spring Training, Regular Season, Post Season)
10. WHEN the DisplayGroup is set to RightRail
Expected Result:
THEN the module will display in the right rail instead of the left on iPad
AND the setting will have no affect on phone devices
Steps Separated (Expected Result):
1. THEN it will persist
AND have no affect on the module displaying on the client
2. THEN it will display on the module header on the left
AND the Spanish text set will display when the device is set to Spanish
3. THEN it will display on the module header on the right
AND the Spanish text set will display when the device is set to Spanish
4. THEN all the user's followed players cards will display in the carousel

5. THEN the selection will seen in the API response
AND will have no adverse affects on the module
6. THEN they will display in the module (only if selected)
AND the Spanish elements set will display when the device is set to Spanish
note: keyGame, nextGame selections currently will be returned in API response  but will have effect on the module
7. THEN the number of user's followed players cards will display in the carousel will be limited by the PlayerLimit setting)
8. THEN the setting will have no effect
Future:
THEN the player data displayed will reflect the set season instead of the default season being used (ex. 2023)
9. THEN games of the set types will be displayed regardless of the point in the season (ex. Spring Training, Regular Season, Post Season)
10. THEN the module will display in the right rail instead of the left on iPad
AND the setting will have no affect on phone devices
Steps Separated (Step):
1. WHEN the Name is set and published
2. WHEN the HeaderText is set
3. WHEN the ActionText is set
4. WHEN "players" is selected for FollowedTypes
AND the PlayerLimit >= # followed players set
5. WHEN "teams" is selected for FollowedTypes
6. WHEN any of the Elements "header, keyGame, stats, highlights, nextGame" are selected
AND "players" is selected for FollowedTypes
7. WHEN the PlayerLimit is set to a positive integer (ex. 3)
AND "players" is selected for FollowedTypes
8. WHEN the SeasonYear is set to a year that is not the current season (exc. 2022)
9. WHEN the GameType is set with a comma separated list of types from https://statsapi.mlb.com/api/v1/gameTypes
10. WHEN the DisplayGroup is set to RightRail

Title: My Follows overrides Year value
Expected Result:
THEN I should see 2016 should be passed along in the query sent from the client
AND I should see 2016 as the "seasonYear" value for MyFollowsModule in the 'getSurfaceConfigBySlug' query in Proxy tool
Preconditions:

AND one or more content types is selected in the module (article, video, story)
AND there is no data returned for those specific content types for an active player

Title: MF - Postseason: seasonStatsGameType override

Expected Result:

Note: the gameType and season settings may also need to be changed to get the desired result
2. GIVEN the seasonStatsGameType has not been set in the MyFollows module
Expected Result:
THEN it will not be sent in the MyFollows API call
AND the default stats per the DGAP setting will be returned for players
Steps Separated (Expected Result):
1. THEN it will be sent in the MyFollows API call
AND the appropriate stats will be returned for players (ex. spring training, postseason, or regular)
Note: the gameType and season settings may also need to be changed to get the desired result
2. THEN it will not be sent in the MyFollows API call
AND the default stats per the DGAP setting will be returned for players
Steps Separated (Step):
1. GIVEN the seasonStatsGameType has been set to S,R or P in the MyFollows module
2. GIVEN the seasonStatsGameType has not been set in the MyFollows module

Title: Audio  - Autoplay video does not interfere with audio
Preconditions: GIVEN a user
Steps Separated:
1. WHEN listening to audio (from other apps, ex Spotify)
AND they open the MLB App (Home Tab)
Expected Result:
THEN the audio continues playing
2. WHEN listening to audio (from other apps, ex Spotify)
AND play a video OR opening a tap story
Expected Result:
THEN the audio stops
AND the audio from the MLB content prevails
3. WHEN listening to audio on the MLB app (ex. game)
AND they open the MLB App (Home Tab)
Expected Result:
THEN the audio continues playing
4. WHEN casting audio on the MLB app (ex. mlb audio airplay, carplay, google cast)
AND they open the MLB App
Expected Result:
THEN the casted audio continues playing
5. WHEN listening to audio from a Tap Story or video on the Home Surface
AND they open another app with audio (ex. iTunes)

Expected Result:
THEN the audio from the Home Surface stops
AND is replaced by the audio from the app
6. WHEN opening the Home Surface
AND they play a video
Expected Result:
THEN the audio from the video plays as expected
7. WHEN the user is listening to audio from a Tap Story or video on the Home Surface
AND they put the app in the background

Expected Result:
THE the audio will pause
8. WHEN they bring another audio app to the foreground
AND start audio on the other app
Expected Result:
THEN the home page audio will still be paused
Steps Separated (Expected Result):
1. THEN the audio continues playing
2. THEN the audio stops
AND the audio from the MLB content prevails
3. THEN the audio continues playing
4. THEN the casted audio continues playing
5. THEN the audio from the Home Surface stops
AND is replaced by the audio from the app
6. THEN the audio from the video plays as expected
7. THE the audio will pause
8. THEN the home page audio will still be paused
Steps Separated (Step):
1. WHEN listening to audio (from other apps, ex Spotify)
AND they open the MLB App (Home Tab)
2. WHEN listening to audio (from other apps, ex Spotify)
AND play a video OR opening a tap story
3. WHEN listening to audio on the MLB app (ex. game)
AND they open the MLB App (Home Tab)
4. WHEN casting audio on the MLB app (ex. mlb audio airplay, carplay, google cast)
AND they open the MLB App
5. WHEN listening to audio from a Tap Story or video on the Home Surface
AND they open another app with audio (ex. iTunes)

6. WHEN opening the Home Surface
AND they play a video
7. WHEN the user is listening to audio from a Tap Story or video on the Home Surface
AND they put the app in the background

8. WHEN they bring another audio app to the foreground
AND start audio on the other app

Steps: WHEN url contains a value

Title: Webview - aspectRatio and height
Preconditions: GIVEN a webview module
Steps Separated:
1. WHEN aspectRatio contains a value
AND height is left empty
Expected Result:
THEN render the webview in the desired aspect ratio
2. WHEN aspectRatio is left empty
OR aspectRatio isn?t in the proper format
AND height is left empty
Expected Result:
THEN render the webview in the 4:3 aspect ratio
3. WHEN height contains a value
Expected Result:
THEN ensure the height of the webview doesn?t surpass the value
AND ignore aspectRatio if set
Steps Separated (Expected Result):
1. THEN render the webview in the desired aspect ratio
2. THEN render the webview in the 4:3 aspect ratio
3. THEN ensure the height of the webview doesn?t surpass the value
AND ignore aspectRatio if set
Steps Separated (Step):
1. WHEN aspectRatio contains a value
AND height is left empty
2. WHEN aspectRatio is left empty
OR aspectRatio isn?t in the proper format
AND height is left empty
3. WHEN height contains a value

Expected Result:
THEN the webview should show as a card that is full bleed edge to edge with no rounded corners
*Layout Box is only supported on phones, tablets should always use Card styles

2. THEN the webview should show as a card that is full bleed edge to edge with no rounded corners
*Layout Box is only supported on phones, tablets should always use Card styles

2. WHEN fullWidth is set to Yes

Expected Result:

Title: Webview - handling html links
Preconditions: GIVEN that I have a webview module configured on a surface
Steps Separated:
1. WHEN the html has a link with the query param app_target=external
AND the link is tapped
Expected Result:
THEN the link should be opened in an external browser
2. WHEN the html has a link with the query param app_target=webview
AND the link is from one of the domains "mlb.com",".mlb.com", "localhost", "scorecardresearch.com", "mlbshop.com", "playball.org", "onetrust.com", "satis.fi"
AND the link is tapped

Expected Result:
THEN the link should be opened in a webview
AND the navigation_context parameter should be respected for both push and modal (iOS only)
3. WHEN the html has a link with the query param app_target=internal
AND the link is tapped

Expected Result:
THEN the link should be opened in SFSafariViewController/ChromeTab

4. WHEN the html has a link without the query param app_target
AND the link is tapped
Expected Result:
THEN the link should be opened inside the module
Steps Separated (Expected Result):
1. THEN the link should be opened in an external browser
2. THEN the link should be opened in a webview
AND the navigation_context parameter should be respected for both push and modal (iOS only)
3. THEN the link should be opened in SFSafariViewController/ChromeTab

4. THEN the link should be opened inside the module
Steps Separated (Step):
1. WHEN the html has a link with the query param app_target=external
AND the link is tapped
2. WHEN the html has a link with the query param app_target=webview
AND the link is from one of the domains "mlb.com",".mlb.com", "localhost", "scorecardresearch.com", "mlbshop.com", "playball.org", "onetrust.com", "satis.fi"
AND the link is tapped

3. WHEN the html has a link with the query param app_target=internal
AND the link is tapped

4. WHEN the html has a link without the query param app_target
AND the link is tapped

AND the html has a link with a deeplink
Steps Separated:
1. WHEN the link is tapped
Expected Result:
THEN the link should be opened within the app appropriately
2. WHEN the deep link contains a query parameter of navigation_context=push

THEN the link should open by being pushed to home's navigation stack

AND the link is tapped

THEN the link should open in the same manner as it would if opened from an external app/browser
Steps Separated (Expected Result):
1. THEN the link should be opened within the app appropriately
2. THEN the link should open by being pushed to home's navigation stack

Note: this applies to iOS only
3. THEN the link should open in the same manner as it would if opened from an external app/browser

1. WHEN the link is tapped
2. WHEN the deep link contains a query parameter of navigation_context=push
AND the home navigator supports push (standings, schedule, gameday)
AND the link is tapped
3. WHEN the deep link nos NOT contain a navigation_context query parameter
AND the link is tapped

Title: Webview - Out-of-Memory handling + Analytics
Steps Separated:
1. GIVEN that I have a webview module
WHEN the webview pushes the memory limit of the app
Expected Result:

THEN a non fatal should be sent to firebase
AND it should include info about where it came from (home)
2. GIVEN that I have a webview module
WHEN the webview pushes the memory limit of the app
Expected Result:
THEN a refresh button should appear in the module

3. GIVEN a refresh button in the webview module due to OOM
WHEN the refresh button is clicked
Expected Result:
THEN the web module should be reloaded
Steps Separated (Expected Result):
1.
THEN a non fatal should be sent to firebase
AND it should include info about where it came from (home)
2. THEN a refresh button should appear in the module

3. THEN the web module should be reloaded

WHEN the webview pushes the memory limit of the app
2. GIVEN that I have a webview module
WHEN the webview pushes the memory limit of the app
3. GIVEN a refresh button in the webview module due to OOM
WHEN the refresh button is clicked

Title: Webview Acceptance - headerText

THEN render that value above the webview

Title: Webview Acceptance - aspectRatio and height
Preconditions: GIVEN a url of a valid webview is set in a webview module
Section Description: Suite to run against webview's developed specifically for the Home Surface webviewModule
Steps Separated:
1. WHEN aspectRatio contains a value
Expected Result:
THEN render the webview in the desired aspect ratio
AND the webview should look/work as expected if it is intended to support this configuration
2. WHEN aspectRatio is left empty
OR aspectRatio isn?t in the proper format
Expected Result:
THEN render the webview in the 4:3 aspect ratio
AND the webview should look/work as expected if it is intended to support this configuration
3. WHEN height contains a value
AND aspectRatio is not set
Expected Result:
THEN ensure the height of the webview doesn?t surpass the value in points
AND the webview should look/work as expected if it is intended to support this configuration
Steps Separated (Expected Result):
1. THEN render the webview in the desired aspect ratio
AND the webview should look/work as expected if it is intended to support this configuration
2. THEN render the webview in the 4:3 aspect ratio
AND the webview should look/work as expected if it is intended to support this configuration
3. THEN ensure the height of the webview doesn?t surpass the value in points
AND the webview should look/work as expected if it is intended to support this configuration
Steps Separated (Step):
1. WHEN aspectRatio contains a value
2. WHEN aspectRatio is left empty
OR aspectRatio isn?t in the proper format
3. WHEN height contains a value
AND aspectRatio is not set

AND the webview should look/work as expected if it is intended to support this configuration

Title: Webview Acceptance - enableScrolling
Preconditions:
GIVEN a webview module in contentful with an option to enable scrolling
AND a valid webview url is set
Section Description: Suite to run against webview's developed specifically for the Home Surface webviewModule
Steps Separated:
1. WHEN ?enable scrolling? is off
AND the page has > 1 line of content
AND the line is longer than the webview dimensions

THEN vertical and horizontal scrolling is disabled in the webview
AND the webview should look/work as expected if it is intended to support this configuration


2. WHEN ?enable scrolling? is off
AND the page has only 1 line of content
AND the line is longer than the webview dimensions
Expected Result:
THEN the line will still be scrollable
AND the webview should look/work as expected if it is intended to support this configuration
3. WHEN ?enable vertical scrolling? is on

Expected Result:
THEN scrolling in the webview is enabled vertically and horizontally
AND the webview should look/work as expected if it is intended to support this configuration
Steps Separated (Expected Result):
1. THEN vertical and horizontal scrolling is disabled in the webview
AND the webview should look/work as expected if it is intended to support this configuration


2. THEN the line will still be scrollable
AND the webview should look/work as expected if it is intended to support this configuration
3. THEN scrolling in the webview is enabled vertically and horizontally
AND the webview should look/work as expected if it is intended to support this configuration
Steps Separated (Step):
1. WHEN ?enable scrolling? is off
AND the page has > 1 line of content
AND the line is longer than the webview dimensions


2. WHEN ?enable scrolling? is off
AND the page has only 1 line of content
AND the line is longer than the webview dimensions
3. WHEN ?enable vertical scrolling? is on

Title: Webview Acceptance - handling html links
Preconditions: GIVEN that I have a webview present
Section Description: Suite to run against webview's developed specifically for the Home Surface webviewModule
Steps Separated:
1. AND the html has a link with the query param app_target=external
WHEN I tap the link
Expected Result:
THEN the link should be opened in an external browser
AND the webview should look/work as expected if it is intended to support this configuration
2. AND the html has a link with the query param app_target=webview
WHEN I tap the link

Expected Result:
THEN the link should be opened in a webview
AND the navigation_context parameter should be respected for both push and modal (iOS only)
AND the webview should look/work as expected if it is intended to support this configuration
3. AND the html has a link with the query param app_target=internal
WHEN I tap the link

Expected Result:
THEN the link should be opened in SFSafariViewController/ChromeTab
AND the webview should look/work as expected if it is intended to support this configuration

4. AND the html has a link without the query param app_target
WHEN I tap the link

Expected Result:
THEN the link should be opened inside the module
AND the webview should look/work as expected if it is intended to support this configuration
Steps Separated (Expected Result):
1. THEN the link should be opened in an external browser
AND the webview should look/work as expected if it is intended to support this configuration
2. THEN the link should be opened in a webview
AND the navigation_context parameter should be respected for both push and modal (iOS only)
AND the webview should look/work as expected if it is intended to support this configuration
3. THEN the link should be opened in SFSafariViewController/ChromeTab
AND the webview should look/work as expected if it is intended to support this configuration

4. THEN the link should be opened inside the module
AND the webview should look/work as expected if it is intended to support this configuration
Steps Separated (Step):
1. AND the html has a link with the query param app_target=external
WHEN I tap the link
2. AND the html has a link with the query param app_target=webview
WHEN I tap the link

3. AND the html has a link with the query param app_target=internal
WHEN I tap the link

4. AND the html has a link without the query param app_target
WHEN I tap the link

Title: Webview Acceptance - Deep link support
Preconditions:
GIVEN that I have a webview present
AND the html has a link with a deeplink
Section Description: Suite to run against webview's developed specifically for the Home Surface webviewModule
Steps Separated:
1. WHEN the link is tapped
Expected Result:
THEN the link should be opened within the app appropriately
2. WHEN the deep link contains a query parameter of navigation_context=push
AND the home navigator supports push (standings, schedule, gameday)
AND the link is tapped
Expected Result:
THEN the link should open by being pushed to home's navigation stack

Note: this applies to iOS only
3. WHEN the deep link nos NOT contain a navigation_context query parameter
AND the link is tapped
Expected Result:
THEN the link should open in the same manner as it would if opened from an external app/browser
Steps Separated (Expected Result):
1. THEN the link should be opened within the app appropriately
2. THEN the link should open by being pushed to home's navigation stack

Note: this applies to iOS only
3. THEN the link should open in the same manner as it would if opened from an external app/browser
Steps Separated (Step):
1. WHEN the link is tapped
2. WHEN the deep link contains a query parameter of navigation_context=push
AND the home navigator supports push (standings, schedule, gameday)
AND the link is tapped
3. WHEN the deep link nos NOT contain a navigation_context query parameter
AND the link is tapped

Title: Article autoplay AppConfig settings - iOS
Preconditions: GIVEN a carousel or mixed feed module
Steps Separated:
1. WHEN recommended or non-recommended content is configured
AND "articleAutoplayLeadVideo" is set to false in AppConfig

Expected Result:
THEN no articles will show autoplay video for the thumbnail
2. WHEN recommended content is configured
AND "articleAutoplayLeadVideo" is set to true in AppConfig
AND "articleRecommendationsFetchLeadVideo" is set to false in AppConfig
Expected Result:
THEN no autoplay video urls will be fetched
AND no articles will show autoplay video for the thumbnail
3. WHEN recommended content is configured
AND "articleAutoplayLeadVideo" is set to true in AppConfig
AND "articleRecommendationsFetchLeadVideo" is set to true in AppConfig
Expected Result:
THEN autoplay video urls will be returned from midfield for articles
AND autoplay video thumbnails will show for all those articles
4. WHEN non-recommended content is configured
AND "articleAutoplayLeadVideo" is set to true in AppConfig
AND "articleRecommendationsFetchLeadVideo" is set to true or false in AppConfig
Expected Result:
THEN autoplay video urls will be returned from midfield
AND autoplay video thumbnails will show for all those articles
Steps Separated (Expected Result):
1. THEN no articles will show autoplay video for the thumbnail
2. THEN no autoplay video urls will be fetched
AND no articles will show autoplay video for the thumbnail
3. THEN autoplay video urls will be returned from midfield for articles
AND autoplay video thumbnails will show for all those articles
4. THEN autoplay video urls will be returned from midfield
AND autoplay video thumbnails will show for all those articles

AND "articleAutoplayLeadVideo" is set to false in AppConfig

AND "articleAutoplayLeadVideo" is set to true in AppConfig
AND "articleRecommendationsFetchLeadVideo" is set to false in AppConfig
3. WHEN recommended content is configured
AND "articleAutoplayLeadVideo" is set to true in AppConfig
AND "articleRecommendationsFetchLeadVideo" is set to true in AppConfig
4. WHEN non-recommended content is configured
AND "articleAutoplayLeadVideo" is set to true in AppConfig
AND "articleRecommendationsFetchLeadVideo" is set to true or false in AppConfig

Title: Carousel Video Autostart Analytics
Preconditions: GIVEN a user on the home page
Steps Separated:
1. WHEN autoplay of a video thumbnail initially begins
Expected Result:
THEN a video start analytics call is made
AND the call will include video.context set to "home"
AND the contentType will be set to "video" for a video
AND the contentType will be set to "article" for an article
AND the call will include context data about the carousel position (index) in addition to the data normally sent with a video start
ex. action MLB At Bat : iPhone : Home Feed : MLB : Content Carousel : Content Card Autoplay Video Start
2. WHEN the autoplay of a video thumbnail continues playing
Expected Result:
THEN the following actions will be sent when each corresponding percent complete is reached:
 ex.
MLB At Bat : iPhone : Home Feed : MLB : Content Carousel : Content Card Autoplay Video 25 percent
MLB At Bat : iPhone : Home Feed : MLB : Content Carousel : Content Card Autoplay Video 50 percent
MLB At Bat : iPhone : Home Feed : MLB : Content Carousel : Content Card Autoplay Video 75 percent
3. WHEN the autoplay of a video thumbnail completes
Expected Result:
THEN the following action will be sent:
 ex.
MLB At Bat : iPhone : Home Feed : MLB : Content Carousel : Content Card Autoplay Video Complete

Title: Autoplay rules
Preconditions:
GIVEN that the "Top Candidate" is defined as the top left-most item visible in the surface with an autoplay url
AND autoplay is enabled for the module in Content
Steps Separated:
1. WHEN the surface is first loaded
Expected Result:
THEN the top candidate for autoplay will be played if possible

2. WHEN the surface is scrolled
Expected Result:
THEN the top candidate for autoplay will be played if possible
3. WHEN no top candidate is found
Expected Result:
THEN the item with the highest percentage visible in the surface is the candidate will be played if possible
4. WHEN the candidate is the same video that is already playing
Expected Result:
THEN the playback will continue at its current location
5. WHEN no candidate is found
Expected Result:
THEN all autoplay videos on the surface should be stopped

Note: check stream or analytics calls in Charles
6. WHEN the home tab or app is backgrounded


Expected Result:
THEN autoplay should be paused/stopped
7. WHEN an autoplay starts
Expected Result:
THEN Audio should be disabled (enabling audio will be done in a future ticket)
AND Video controls should be hidden
Steps Separated (Expected Result):
1. THEN the top candidate for autoplay will be played if possible

2. THEN the top candidate for autoplay will be played if possible
3. THEN the item with the highest percentage visible in the surface is the candidate will be played if possible
4. THEN the playback will continue at its current location
5. THEN all autoplay videos on the surface should be stopped

Note: check stream or analytics calls in Charles
6. THEN autoplay should be paused/stopped
7. THEN Audio should be disabled (enabling audio will be done in a future ticket)
AND Video controls should be hidden
Steps Separated (Step):
1. WHEN the surface is first loaded
2. WHEN the surface is scrolled
3. WHEN no top candidate is found
4. WHEN the candidate is the same video that is already playing
5. WHEN no candidate is found
6. WHEN the home tab or app is backgrounded


7. WHEN an autoplay starts

Title: Video Analytics New
Preconditions: GIVEN a user on the Home Surface
Steps Separated:
1. WHEN a video is tapped or autoplays from the Mixed Feed or Content Carousel
Expected Result:
THEN the following analytics calls will be sent to Adobe:

Events:
MLB At Bat : <Platform Name> : Video Start
MLB At Bat : <Platform Name> : Video Player : Video 25 Percent Complete
MLB At Bat : <Platform Name> : Video Player : Video 50 Percent Complete
MLB At Bat : <Platform Name> : Video Player : Video 75 Percent Complete
MLB At Bat : <Platform Name> : Video Complete

Dimensions:
video.autoplay - Set to true if video automatically plays, set to false if user started the video by clicking
video.contentId	- Captures the contentid name
video.context - the surface slug
video.contentType - Sets type of video. Exampels: VOD, or SVOD
video.title - the full title of the video
video.fguid - playback instance guid (8-4-4-4-12)
video.slug - Captures video slug name
action.element.contentType - video | article
action.element.article.slug - the slug article, present if article
action.element.video.slug - the video slug, same value as video. section
2. WHEN an autoplay video is tapped
Expected Result:
THEN video.autoplay is false for the next action
Steps Separated (Expected Result):
1. THEN the following analytics calls will be sent to Adobe:

Events:
MLB At Bat : <Platform Name> : Video Start
MLB At Bat : <Platform Name> : Video Player : Video 25 Percent Complete
MLB At Bat : <Platform Name> : Video Player : Video 50 Percent Complete
MLB At Bat : <Platform Name> : Video Player : Video 75 Percent Complete
MLB At Bat : <Platform Name> : Video Complete

Dimensions:
video.autoplay - Set to true if video automatically plays, set to false if user started the video by clicking
video.contentId	- Captures the contentid name
video.context - the surface slug
video.contentType - Sets type of video. Exampels: VOD, or SVOD
video.title - the full title of the video
video.fguid - playback instance guid (8-4-4-4-12)
video.slug - Captures video slug name
action.element.contentType - video | article
action.element.article.slug - the slug article, present if article
action.element.video.slug - the video slug, same value as video. section
2. THEN video.autoplay is false for the next action
Steps Separated (Step):
1. WHEN a video is tapped or autoplays from the Mixed Feed or Content Carousel
2. WHEN an autoplay video is tapped

Title: GMM - TimeCode (Polling)
Preconditions: GIVEN a GDM Module configured on a surface
Steps Separated:
1. WHEN a the user's favorite team is live
AND showing in the GDM
Expected Result:
THEN calls are made to the timecode endpoint: https://statsapi.mlb.com/api/v1.1/game/{gamePk}/feed/live/timestamps?limit=1
AND the frequency of the calls will be according to the RefreshRate setting in Contentful (currently 15s)
2. WHEN the last timecode in the response is != to the last timecode from the previous response
Expected Result:
THEN a call will be made to midfield using the timecode
3. WHEN the last timecode in the response is = to the last timecode from the previous response
Expected Result:
THEN no call will be made to midfield
4. WHEN the user tabs away from the home surface
OR backgrounds the MLB App
Expected Result:
THEN no calls will be made to the timecode service or midfield
5. WHEN the user returns to the home surface
Expected Result:
THEN calls to the timecode service resume
AND calls to midfield per the rules in previous steps
Steps Separated (Expected Result):
1. THEN calls are made to the timecode endpoint: https://statsapi.mlb.com/api/v1.1/game/{gamePk}/feed/live/timestamps?limit=1
AND the frequency of the calls will be according to the RefreshRate setting in Contentful (currently 15s)
2. THEN a call will be made to midfield using the timecode
3. THEN no call will be made to midfield
4. THEN no calls will be made to the timecode service or midfield
5. THEN calls to the timecode service resume
AND calls to midfield per the rules in previous steps
Steps Separated (Step):
1. WHEN a the user's favorite team is live
AND showing in the GDM
2. WHEN the last timecode in the response is != to the last timecode from the previous response
3. WHEN the last timecode in the response is = to the last timecode from the previous response
4. WHEN the user tabs away from the home surface
OR backgrounds the MLB App
5. WHEN the user returns to the home surface

Title: GMM - Final State Behavior
Steps Separated:
1. GIVEN a user
WHEN their favorite team is live
AND then the game ends (enters final state)
Expected Result:
THEN continue to show the ?Live Mode? surface
AND the Gameday module is the top module
2. GIVEN a user
WHEN their favorite team?s game recently concluded
AND they swipe down to refresh their feed
Expected Result:
THEN do NOT render the ?Live Mode? surface
AND the Favorite Team Snapshot is the top module
3. GIVEN a Gameday module
WHEN a game is in final state
Expected Result:
THEN render ?FINAL?
4. GIVEN a Gameday module
WHEN a game is in final state
Expected Result:
THEN show the most recent pitcher
AND show the most recent hitter
5. GIVEN a game
WHEN the game ends
Expected Result:
THEN update the count (ex. 3-3, 0-3, etc.)
AND update the outs (ex. 3 solid dots)
6. GIVEN a Gameday module
WHEN a game is in final state
Expected Result:
THEN continue to render the links as they were
Steps Separated (Expected Result):
1. THEN continue to show the ?Live Mode? surface
AND the Gameday module is the top module
2. THEN do NOT render the ?Live Mode? surface
AND the Favorite Team Snapshot is the top module
3. THEN render ?FINAL?
4. THEN show the most recent pitcher
AND show the most recent hitter
5. THEN update the count (ex. 3-3, 0-3, etc.)
AND update the outs (ex. 3 solid dots)
6. THEN continue to render the links as they were
Steps Separated (Step):
1. GIVEN a user
WHEN their favorite team is live
AND then the game ends (enters final state)
2. GIVEN a user
WHEN their favorite team?s game recently concluded
AND they swipe down to refresh their feed
3. GIVEN a Gameday module
WHEN a game is in final state
4. GIVEN a Gameday module
WHEN a game is in final state
5. GIVEN a game
WHEN the game ends
6. GIVEN a Gameday module
WHEN a game is in final state

Title: GMM - timecode from websocket
Preconditions: GIVEN a user watching a live game in the GMM
Steps Separated:
1. WHEN webservice based timecode is disabled
Ex. iOS Release Flags -> surfaceBuilder -> usesWebSockets false, Android firebase: surface_enable_timecode_socket false
Expected Result:
THEN polling service calls similar to the below will be seen reliably and regularly: https://statsapi.mlb.com/api/v1.1/game/745818/feed/live/timestamps?limit=1&delay=11
2. WHEN webservice based timecode is enabled
Ex. iOS Release Flags -> surfaceBuilder -> usesWebSockets true, Android firebase: surface_enable_timecode_socket true
Expected Result:
THEN websocket calls similar to the below will be seen reliably and regularly: https://ws.statsapi.mlb.com/api/v1.1/game/745818/feed/live?language=en&timecode=20240528_204703
3. WHEN the user navigates away
AND returns to the home surface
Expected Result:
THEN the calls will stop
AND will resume when the user returns to the page
4. WHEN the user backgrounds the MLB App
AND returns it to the foreground
Expected Result:
THEN the calls will stop
AND will resume when the app returns to the foreground
5. WHEN the game shows the FINAL state
Expected Result:
THEN the calls will stop
Steps Separated (Expected Result):
1. THEN polling service calls similar to the below will be seen reliably and regularly: https://statsapi.mlb.com/api/v1.1/game/745818/feed/live/timestamps?limit=1&delay=11
2. THEN websocket calls similar to the below will be seen reliably and regularly: https://ws.statsapi.mlb.com/api/v1.1/game/745818/feed/live?language=en&timecode=20240528_204703
3. THEN the calls will stop
AND will resume when the user returns to the page
4. THEN the calls will stop
AND will resume when the app returns to the foreground
5. THEN the calls will stop
Steps Separated (Step):
1. WHEN webservice based timecode is disabled
Ex. iOS Release Flags -> surfaceBuilder -> usesWebSockets false, Android firebase: surface_enable_timecode_socket false
2. WHEN webservice based timecode is enabled
Ex. iOS Release Flags -> surfaceBuilder -> usesWebSockets true, Android firebase: surface_enable_timecode_socket true
3. WHEN the user navigates away
AND returns to the home surface
4. WHEN the user backgrounds the MLB App
AND returns it to the foreground
5. WHEN the game shows the FINAL state

Title: Layout Mapping Midfield Manual
Preconditions: GIVEN that I pass a segment to the segmentation query
Steps Separated:
1. AND I pass a team id
AND the team does not have a live game
AND there is a segment association in contentful without a live game state
Expected Result:
THEN I should receive that surface
2. AND I pass no team id or zero
AND there is a segment association in contentful without a live game state
Expected Result:
THEN I should receive that surface
3. AND I pass a team id
AND the team has a live game running
AND there is a segment association in contentful with a live game state
Expected Result:
THEN I should receive that surface
4. AND there is no matching segment in contentful

Expected Result:
THEN I should receive the default surface
Steps Separated (Expected Result):
1. THEN I should receive that surface
2. THEN I should receive that surface
3. THEN I should receive that surface
4. THEN I should receive the default surface
Steps Separated (Step):
1. AND I pass a team id
AND the team does not have a live game
AND there is a segment association in contentful without a live game state
2. AND I pass no team id or zero
AND there is a segment association in contentful without a live game state
3. AND I pass a team id
AND the team has a live game running
AND there is a segment association in contentful with a live game state
4. AND there is no matching segment in contentful

Title: Cache Adobe Target Tests
Steps Separated:
1. GIVEN that my device is part of an A/B test
WHEN I have been successfully loaded the target request my last launch of the app
AND the request to target to load the A/B test fails with an error

Expected Result:
THEN I should still be part of the A/B test
2. GIVEN that my device is part of an A/B test
WHEN I have not successfully loaded the target request my initial launch of the app
AND the request to target to load the A/B test fails with an error

Expected Result:
THEN I should not be part of the A/B test
3. GIVEN that my device has previously been part of an A/B test
WHEN the A/B test is stopped
AND the request to target to load the A/B test succedes with no data

Expected Result:
THEN I should not be part of the A/B test
4. GIVEN that my device has previously been part of an A/B test
WHEN the A/B tests is stopped
AND the request to target to load the A/B test fails with an error
Expected Result:
THEN I should still be part of the A/B test
Steps Separated (Expected Result):
1. THEN I should still be part of the A/B test
2. THEN I should not be part of the A/B test
3. THEN I should not be part of the A/B test
4. THEN I should still be part of the A/B test
Steps Separated (Step):
1. GIVEN that my device is part of an A/B test
WHEN I have been successfully loaded the target request my last launch of the app
AND the request to target to load the A/B test fails with an error

2. GIVEN that my device is part of an A/B test
WHEN I have not successfully loaded the target request my initial launch of the app
AND the request to target to load the A/B test fails with an error

3. GIVEN that my device has previously been part of an A/B test
WHEN the A/B test is stopped
AND the request to target to load the A/B test succedes with no data

4. GIVEN that my device has previously been part of an A/B test
WHEN the A/B tests is stopped
AND the request to target to load the A/B test fails with an error

Title: Segmentation Service - authorization header
Preconditions: GIVEN a request is made to the segmentation service
Steps Separated:
1. WHEN a user is logged in
Expected Result:
THEN an authorization header in sent in the form:
authorization: Bearer <token string>
AND if segments are mapped based on entitled or not entitled users the correct segment is returned based on the user's entitlements
2. WHEN a user is not logged in
Expected Result:
THEN an authorization header in sent in the form:
authorization: Bearer (Android only, iOS omits the entire header)
AND if segments are mapped based on entitled or not entitled users the not entitled segment is returned
3. WHEN the entire authorization header is omitted
AND if segments are mapped based on entitled or not entitled users
Expected Result:
THEN the not entitled segment is returned
Steps Separated (Expected Result):
1. THEN an authorization header in sent in the form:
authorization: Bearer <token string>
AND if segments are mapped based on entitled or not entitled users the correct segment is returned based on the user's entitlements
2. THEN an authorization header in sent in the form:
authorization: Bearer (Android only, iOS omits the entire header)
AND if segments are mapped based on entitled or not entitled users the not entitled segment is returned
3. THEN the not entitled segment is returned
Steps Separated (Step):
1. WHEN a user is logged in
2. WHEN a user is not logged in
3. WHEN the entire authorization header is omitted
AND if segments are mapped based on entitled or not entitled users

-Analytics Name for Home is currently taken from the Surface and in set to "Home Feed" in Prod.

Title: Configurable Delay

{
  "enabled": true,
  "delay": 8.5
}
Note: the delay is in seconds
Expected Result:

Note: Platform delay for iOS is 20s, Android is 28s.  Developers were not able to explain the reason for the platform delay
2. WHEN a delay is set in the live mode Adobe Activity, ex:

{
  "enabled": true
}
Expected Result:
THEN the timecode sent in the GamedayMini midfield call will be (current time) - (platform delay)

Note: Platform delay for iOS is 20s, Android is 28s.  Developers were not able to explain the reason for the platform delay

2. THEN the timecode sent in the GamedayMini midfield call will be (current time) - (platform delay)

Note: Platform delay for iOS is 20s, Android is 28s.  Developers were not able to explain the reason for the platform delay

AND the last timestamp in the list returned is the same as the previous call
